official-title.#text:
To provide safeguards with respect to the Federal Bureau
		  of Investigation criminal background checks prepared for employment purposes,
		  and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Fairness and Accuracy in Employment
			 Background Checks Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish and enforce procedures to ensure the prompt release of
			 accurate records and information exchanged for employment-related purposes
			 through the records system created under

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall include the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fairness and Accuracy in Employment Background Checks Act of 2013/s:2

text.#text:
The procedures
			 established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that a record or information is inaccurate, the

shall promptly correct that record or information or, if
			 appropriate, promptly make any changes or deletions to the records or
			 information.

text.#text: If the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that a record or information is incomplete or cannot be
			 verified, the

shall attempt to complete or verify the record
			 or information, and if the
is unable to do so, the

may promptly make any changes or deletions to the record or
			 information.

text.#text: If the

For the purposes of this paragraph, an
			 incomplete record or information includes a record or information that
			 indicates there was an arrest and does not include the disposition of that
			 arrest.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fairness and Accuracy in Employment Background Checks Act of 2013/s:3/p:2/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, not later than 10 days after the requesting
			 entity requests the exchange and before the exchange is made, obtain the
			 disposition (if any) of the arrest.

text.#text:
If the record or
			 information is an incomplete record or information described in

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Opportunity to
			 review records or information by applicant

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text:
In connection with an exchange of such a
			 record or information, the

provide to the
			 applicant an opportunity to obtain a copy of the record or information upon
			 request and to challenge the accuracy and completeness of that record or
			 information;

promptly notify the requesting entity of
			 any such challenge;

provide to the
			 applicant the specific findings and results of that investigation;

promptly make any
			 changes or deletions to the records or information required as a result of the
			 challenge; and

report those changes to the requesting
			 entity.

An exchange shall not include any record or
			 information—

relating to an adult or juvenile
			 non-serious offense of the sort described in

external-xref.#tail:
of title 28, Code
			 of Federal Regulations, as in effect on July 1, 2009; or

text.#text:
to the extent the
			 record or information is not clearly an arrest or a disposition of an
			 arrest.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may collect reasonable
			 fees for all exchanges of records or information for employment-related
			 purposes through the records system created under

, to defray the costs associated with exchanges for those
			 purposes, including any costs associated with the investigation of inaccurate
			 or incomplete records or information.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue regulations to carry out this Act.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit an annual report to
that includes—

text.#text:
For each of the
			 first 3 years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act, the

the number of exchanges of records or
			 information for employment-related purposes made with entities in each State
			 through the records system created under

appropriate
			 statistical information to determine whether the exchange of records or
			 information about arrests that did not result in convictions is affecting the
			 employment opportunities of employees to whom those records or information
			 pertain;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for information about dispositions of arrests;

text.#text:
any prolonged
				failure of a reporting jurisdiction to comply with a request by the

the percent of missing arrest dispositions
			 located within the time limit required by this Act; and

the numbers of successful and unsuccessful
			 challenges to the accuracy and completeness of records or information, by State
			 where the records and information originated.

header.#text:
Report on
			 statutory and regulatory restrictions and disqualifications based on criminal
			 records

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall report to

on all Federal
			 statutes, regulations, and policies providing employment restrictions and
			 disqualifications based on criminal records.

text.#text:
Not later than one year after the date of the enactment
			 of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall identify each occupation or position to which such
			 restrictions or disqualifications apply, and for each such occupation or
			 position, include—

text.#text:
In the report,
			 the

a description of
			 the restriction or disqualification;

the duration of
			 the restriction or disqualification;

any information
			 available about the numbers of individuals restricted or disqualified on the
			 basis of a criminal record; and

the identity of
			 the Federal agency with jurisdiction over the restriction or
			 disqualification.
In this Act—
